title: Should a U.S. Flag Be Burned Once It Has Touched the Ground?
subtitle: A misunderstanding of flag protocol has led to the mistaken belief that a U.S. flag should be destroyed -- specifically by burning it -- if it has been allowed to touch the ground.
author: David Mikkelson
vclaim: Flag protocol specifies that a U.S. flag should be burned if it has been allowed to touch the ground.
